member.name: T:OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4
member.summary: Represents a color with 4 floating-point components (R, G, B, A).

member.name: F:OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4.R
member.summary: The red component of this Color4 structure.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4.G
member.summary: The green component of this Color4 structure.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4.B
member.summary: The blue component of this Color4 structure.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4.A
member.summary: The alpha component of this Color4 structure.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Constructs a new Color4 structure from the specified components.
member.param: The red component of the new Color4 structure.
The green component of the new Color4 structure.
The blue component of the new Color4 structure.
The alpha component of the new Color4 structure.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4.#ctor(System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Constructs a new Color4 structure from the specified components.
member.param: The red component of the new Color4 structure.
The green component of the new Color4 structure.
The blue component of the new Color4 structure.
The alpha component of the new Color4 structure.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4.ToArgb
member.summary: Converts this color to an integer representation with 8 bits per channel.
member.returns: A that represents this instance.
member.remarks: This method is intended only for compatibility with System.Drawing. It compresses the color into 8 bits per channel, which means color information is lost.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4.op_Equality(OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4,OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4)
member.summary: Compares the specified Color4 structures for equality.
member.param: The left-hand side of the comparison.
The right-hand side of the comparison.
member.returns: True if left is equal to right; false otherwise.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4.op_Inequality(OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4,OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4)
member.summary: Compares the specified Color4 structures for inequality.
member.param: The left-hand side of the comparison.
The right-hand side of the comparison.
member.returns: True if left is not equal to right; false otherwise.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4.op_Implicit(System.Drawing.Color)~OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4
member.summary: Converts the specified System.Drawing.Color to a Color4 structure.
member.returns: A new Color4 structure containing the converted components.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4.op_Explicit(OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4)~System.Drawing.Color
member.summary: Converts the specified Color4 to a System.Drawing.Color structure.
member.returns: A new System.Drawing.Color structure containing the converted components.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares whether this Color4 structure is equal to the specified object.
member.returns: True obj is a Color4 structure with the same components as this Color4; false otherwise.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4.GetHashCode
member.summary: Calculates the hash code for this Color4 structure.
member.returns: A System.Int32 containing the hashcode of this Color4 structure.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4.ToString
member.summary: Creates a System.String that describes this Color4 structure.
member.returns: A System.String that describes this Color4 structure.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4.FromSrgb(OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4)
member.summary: Converts sRGB color values to RGB color values.
member.returns: Returns the converted color value.
member.param: Color value to convert in sRGB.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4.ToSrgb(OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4)
member.summary: Converts RGB color values to sRGB color values.
member.returns: Returns the converted color value.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4.FromHsl(OpenTK.Mathematics.Vector4)
member.summary: Converts HSL color values to RGB color values.
member.returns: Returns the converted color value.
member.param: Color value to convert in hue, saturation, lightness (HSL). The X element is Hue (H), the Y element is Saturation (S), the Z element is Lightness (L), and the W element is Alpha (which is copied to the output's Alpha value). Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4.ToHsl(OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4)
member.summary: Converts RGB color values to HSL color values.
member.returns: Returns the converted color value. The X element is Hue (H), the Y element is Saturation (S), the Z element is Lightness (L), and the W element is Alpha (a copy of the input's Alpha value). Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4.FromHsv(OpenTK.Mathematics.Vector4)
member.summary: Converts HSV color values to RGB color values.
member.returns: Returns the converted color value.
member.param: Color value to convert in hue, saturation, value (HSV). The X element is Hue (H), the Y element is Saturation (S), the Z element is Value (V), and the W element is Alpha (which is copied to the output's Alpha value). Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4.ToHsv(OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4)
member.summary: Converts RGB color values to HSV color values.
member.returns: Returns the converted color value. The X element is Hue (H), the Y element is Saturation (S), the Z element is Value (V), and the W element is Alpha (a copy of the input's Alpha value). Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4.FromXyz(OpenTK.Mathematics.Vector4)
member.summary: Converts XYZ color values to RGB color values.
member.returns: Returns the converted color value.
member.param: Color value to convert with the trisimulus values of X, Y, and Z in the corresponding element, and the W element with Alpha (which is copied to the output's Alpha value). Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0.
member.remarks: Uses the CIE XYZ colorspace.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4.ToXyz(OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4)
member.summary: Converts RGB color values to XYZ color values.
member.returns: Returns the converted color value with the trisimulus values of X, Y, and Z in the corresponding element, and the W element with Alpha (a copy of the input's Alpha value). Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0.
member.remarks: Uses the CIE XYZ colorspace.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4.FromYcbcr(OpenTK.Mathematics.Vector4)
member.summary: Converts YCbCr color values to RGB color values.
member.returns: Returns the converted color value.
member.param: Color value to convert in Luma-Chrominance (YCbCr) aka YUV. The X element contains Luma (Y, 0.0 to 1.0), the Y element contains Blue-difference chroma (U, -0.5 to 0.5), the Z element contains the Red-difference chroma (V, -0.5 to 0.5), and the W element contains the Alpha (which is copied to the output's Alpha value).
member.remarks: Converts using ITU-R BT.601/CCIR 601 W(r) = 0.299 W(b) = 0.114 U(max) = 0.436 V(max) = 0.615.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4.ToYcbcr(OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4)
member.summary: Converts RGB color values to YUV color values.
member.returns: Returns the converted color value in Luma-Chrominance (YCbCr) aka YUV. The X element contains Luma (Y, 0.0 to 1.0), the Y element contains Blue-difference chroma (U, -0.5 to 0.5), the Z element contains the Red-difference chroma (V, -0.5 to 0.5), and the W element contains the Alpha (a copy of the input's Alpha value). Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0.
member.remarks: Converts using ITU-R BT.601/CCIR 601 W(r) = 0.299 W(b) = 0.114 U(max) = 0.436 V(max) = 0.615.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4.FromHcy(OpenTK.Mathematics.Vector4)
member.summary: Converts HCY color values to RGB color values.
member.returns: Returns the converted color value.
member.param: Color value to convert in hue, chroma, luminance (HCY). The X element is Hue (H), the Y element is Chroma (C), the Z element is luminance (Y), and the W element is Alpha (which is copied to the output's Alpha value). Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4.ToHcy(OpenTK.Mathematics.Color4)
member.summary: Converts RGB color values to HCY color values.
member.returns: Returns the converted color value. The X element is Hue (H), the Y element is Chroma (C), the Z element is luminance (Y), and the W element is Alpha (a copy of the input's Alpha value). Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0.

member.name: T:OpenTK.Mathematics.Half
member.summary: The name Half is derived from half-precision floating-point number. It occupies only 16 bits, which are split into 1 Sign bit, 5 Exponent bits and 10 Mantissa bits.
member.remarks: Quote from ARB_half_float_pixel specification: Any representable 16-bit floating-point value is legal as input to a GL command that accepts 16-bit floating-point data. The result of providing a value that is not a floating-point number (such as infinity or NaN) to such a command is unspecified, but must not lead to GL interruption or termination. Providing a denormalized number or negative zero to GL must yield predictable results.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Mathematics.Half.Equals(OpenTK.Mathematics.Half)
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether this instance is equal to a specified OpenTK.Half value.
member.param: OpenTK.Half object to compare to this instance..
member.returns: True, if other is equal to this instance; false otherwise.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Mathematics.Half.CompareTo(OpenTK.Mathematics.Half)
member.summary: Compares this instance to a specified half-precision floating-point number and returns an integer that indicates whether the value of this instance is less than, equal to, or greater than the value of the specified half-precision floating-point number.
member.param: A half-precision floating-point number to compare.
member.returns:
A signed number indicating the relative values of this instance and value. If the number is:
Less than zero, then this instance is less than other, or this instance is not a number (OpenTK.Half.NaN) and other is a number.
Zero: this instance is equal to value, or both this instance and other are not a number (OpenTK.Half.NaN), OpenTK.Half.PositiveInfinity, or OpenTK.Half.NegativeInfinity.
Greater than zero: this instance is greater than othrs, or this instance is a number and other is not a number (OpenTK.Half.NaN).

member.name: T:OpenTK.Mathematics.BezierCurve
member.summary: Represents a bezier curve with as many points as you want.

member.name: F:OpenTK.Mathematics.BezierCurve.Parallel
member.summary: The parallel value.
member.remarks: This value defines whether the curve should be calculated as a parallel curve to the original bezier curve. A value of 0.0f represents the original curve, 5.0f i.e. stands for a curve that has always a distance of 5.0f to the orignal curve at any point.

member.name: P:OpenTK.Mathematics.BezierCurve.Points
member.summary: Gets the points of this curve.
member.remarks: The first point and the last points represent the anchor points.

member.summary: Calculates the length of this bezier curve.

member.remarks: The precision gets better as the value gets smaller.

member.summary: Calculates the length of the specified bezier curve.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Mathematics.BezierCurve.CalculateLength(System.Collections.Generic.IList{OpenTK.Mathematics.Vector2},System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Calculates the length of the specified bezier curve.
member.returns: Length of curve.

remarks.para: The precision gets better as the value gets smaller.

The parameter defines whether the curve should be calculated as a parallel curve to the original bezier curve. A value of 0.0f represents the original curve, 5.0f represents a curve that has always a distance of 5.0f to the orignal curve.

member.summary: Calculates the point on the given bezier curve with the specified t parameter.
member.param: The t parameter, a value between 0.0f and 1.0f.
member.returns: Resulting point.

member.summary: Calculates the point on the given bezier curve with the specified t parameter.
member.param: The t parameter, a value between 0.0f and 1.0f.
member.returns: Resulting point.
member.remarks: The parameter defines whether the curve should be calculated as a parallel curve to the original bezier curve. A value of 0.0f represents the original curve, 5.0f represents a curve that has always a distance of 5.0f to the orignal curve.

member.summary: Calculates the point with the specified t of the derivative of the given bezier function.
member.param: The t parameter, value between 0.0f and 1.0f.
member.returns: Resulting point.

member.remarks: This is an improved implementation of the the method known as Carmack's inverse square root which is found in the Quake III source code. This implementation comes from http://www.codemaestro.com/reviews/review00000105.html. For the history of this method, see http://www.beyond3d.com/content/articles/8/

member.name: M:OpenTK.Mathematics.MathHelper.ApproximatelyEqual(System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Approximates floating point equality with a maximum number of different bits. This is typically used in place of an epsilon comparison. see: https://randomascii.wordpress.com/2012/02/25/comparing-floating-point-numbers-2012-edition/ see: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3874627/floating-point-comparison-functions-for-c-sharp
member.param: the number of floating point bits to check

member.name: M:OpenTK.Mathematics.MathHelper.ApproximatelyEqualEpsilon(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Approximates double-precision floating point equality by an epsilon (maximum error) value. This method is designed as a "fits-all" solution and attempts to handle as many cases as possible.
member.param: The maximum error between the two.
member.returns: true if the values are approximately equal within the error margin; otherwise, false .

member.name: M:OpenTK.Mathematics.MathHelper.ApproximatelyEqualEpsilon(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Approximates single-precision floating point equality by an epsilon (maximum error) value. This method is designed as a "fits-all" solution and attempts to handle as many cases as possible.
member.param: The maximum error between the two.
member.returns: true if the values are approximately equal within the error margin; otherwise, false .

member.name: M:OpenTK.Mathematics.MathHelper.ApproximatelyEquivalent(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Approximates equivalence between two single-precision floating-point numbers on a direct human scale. It is important to note that this does not approximate equality - instead, it merely checks whether or not two numbers could be considered equivalent to each other within a certain tolerance. The tolerance is inclusive.
member.param: The tolerance within which the two values would be considered equivalent.
member.returns: Whether or not the values can be considered equivalent within the tolerance.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Mathematics.MathHelper.ApproximatelyEquivalent(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Approximates equivalence between two double-precision floating-point numbers on a direct human scale. It is important to note that this does not approximate equality - instead, it merely checks whether or not two numbers could be considered equivalent to each other within a certain tolerance. The tolerance is inclusive.
member.param: The tolerance within which the two values would be considered equivalent.
member.returns: Whether or not the values can be considered equivalent within the tolerance.

member.name: M:OpenTK.Mathematics.Matrix4.CreatePerspectiveFieldOfView(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,OpenTK.Mathematics.Matrix4@)
member.summary: Creates a perspective projection matrix.
member.param: Angle of the field of view in the y direction (in radians)
Aspect ratio of the view (width / height)
Distance to the near clip plane
Distance to the far clip plane
A projection matrix that transforms camera space to raster space
member.exception:
Thrown under the following conditions:
fovy is zero, less than zero or larger than Math.PI
aspect is negative or zero
zNear is negative or zero
zFar is negative or zero
zNear is larger than zFar

member.name: M:OpenTK.Mathematics.Matrix4d.CreatePerspectiveFieldOfView(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,OpenTK.Mathematics.Matrix4d@)
member.summary: Creates a perspective projection matrix.
member.param: Angle of the field of view in the y direction (in radians)
Aspect ratio of the view (width / height)
Distance to the near clip plane
Distance to the far clip plane
A projection matrix that transforms camera space to raster space
member.exception:
Thrown under the following conditions:
fovy is zero, less than zero or larger than Math.PI
aspect is negative or zero
zNear is negative or zero
zFar is negative or zero
zNear is larger than zFar

member.returns: The vector in object space.
